marklogic.body:
That drill had some nice Spots and some not so nice Spots. I know is not a big guy and not a pounding runner but some times he looked hesitant and wanted to dance to find a hole. Defenses are too fast in the SEC for that to work. See tapes of when bolden usually got tackled for a loss after studderstepping.
Now Nick Parker and Devin Thomas understand that drill. They hit the hole full speed and wedged a crease into a gash for a couple of yards when nothing was there and hit full speed through the hole when it was wide enough.
Scott is a great scat back and will get plenty of touches but i believe that the big pounding workhorses are what makes and breaks our running game.
